page.title: 01LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: The area contains the N.E.corner of East Grinstead.There is a council estate with a church,a parade of three shops and a public house (The Guinea Pig). On the other side of the main road there is an estate the roads of which have names connected with the R.A.F.in World War 2. The rest of the area is mostly farm- land - a little arable, but more grazing land for sheep and cattle- but there is also woodland with a few ponds big enough for fishing. There is also a direct link with the original Domesday Book : "In Calvestrot(Shovelstrode)the Earl(Earl Robert of Mortain,half-brother of William the Conqueror) has 1 hide. The present Shovelstrode Manor is a large private house.
